limits_on_services: Methadone used for MAT can only be prescribed and dispensed by Opioid Treatment Programs licensed by the Ohio Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services or providers who meet the SAMHSA and DEA criteria for handling controlled substances and have a terminal distributor license through the Ohio Board of Pharmacy. Outside OTPs Ohio Medicaid only covers methadone for use in controlling pain.

copayment_required: Generic status of uncompounded products: $1.00, Brand status: $3.00, Maximum copayment of $12.00 per member, per provider, per calendar month.
$3 Copay (excludes EPSDT, LTC and pregnant women)
limits_on_services: Requires Prior Authorization, Quantity Limits,  2 Brand/5 prescription per month limit
Prior approval with specific treatment plan

copayment_required: $1 for generic and preferred brand name drugs; $3 for other brand name drugs

limits_on_services: Methadone clinics provide this service. At POS, only provided for cancer pain.
Methadone Maintenance requires PA  -Methadone Maintenance Clinics reimbursed a daily rate.
24 months/lifetime. However, services may be provided beyond 24 months  with prior authorization
Methadone for Medication-Assisted Treatment is only available through Methadone Treatment Centers. It is not covered through the Medicaid outpatient pharmacy benefit.
Covered when provided by opioid treatment programs (OTPs), but only available in Fairbanks or Anchorage

copayment_required: 6 per month limit, up to 2 brand-name; $4 copay for each prescription.

limits_on_services: Only available at an opioid treatment program; limited to 30 take home doses per month
